sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

sentences.english: a knife and fork
sentences.chinese: 一副刀叉

sentences.english: Some young people are carrying knives to defend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 一些年轻人带着刀子防身。

sentences.english: a kitchen knife
sentences.chinese: 厨房用刀

sentences.english: Use a sharp knife to cut the melon into sections.
sentences.chinese: 用快刀把瓜切成块。

detailed_translations.english: a metal blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon
to put a knife into someone’s body

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

sentences.english: He girded his sword on.
sentences.chinese: 他佩带上他的剑。

detailed_translations.english: a weapon with a long pointed blade and a handle

sentences.english: He whipped the horse into a canter.
sentences.chinese: 他抽了一下鞭子，马儿就小跑起来。

sentences.english: The coachman cracked his whip and the carriage lurched forward.
sentences.chinese: 马车夫甩了一记响鞭，马车猛然向前冲去。

detailed_translations.english: to hit someone or something with a whip
a long thin piece of rope or leather with a handle, that you hit animals with to make them move or that you hit someone with to punish them

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

sentences.english: The governor found himself at the center of a political storm .
sentences.chinese: 州长发现自己处于一场政治风暴的中心。

sentences.english: An angry crowd stormed the embassy.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的人群突然袭击大使馆。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people suddenly express very strong feelings about something that someone has said or done
to suddenly attack and enter a place using a lot of force

sentences.english: We were woken in the night by thunder.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我们被雷声惊醒。

detailed_translations.english: the loud noise that you hear during a storm, usually after a flash of lightning
if it thunders, there is a loud noise in the sky, usually after a flash of lightning
to make a very loud deep noise

sentences.english: A gust of wind drove down the valley.
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风掠过山谷。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind, air, rain etc
if the wind gusts, it blows strongly with sudden short movements

sentences.english: a light covering of snow
sentences.chinese: 薄薄的一层雪

detailed_translations.english: something that covers or hides something

sentences.english: wild birds
sentences.chinese: 野鸟

sentences.english: The dawn was filled with the sound of birds.
sentences.chinese: 黎明时分，鸟鸣声不绝于耳。

sentences.english: a flock of birds
sentences.chinese: 一群飞鸟

sentences.english: a wooden bird cage
sentences.chinese: 木制鸟笼

detailed_translations.english: a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs
